Package ca.yapper.yapperapp.EntrantFragments

Class EventDetailsFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
ca.yapper.yapperapp.EntrantFragments.EventDetailsFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class EventDetailsFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
The EventDetailsFragment class displays detailed information about a specific event. This fragment retrieves event details from Firestore and displays them to the user.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment

    androidx.fragment.app.Fragment.InstantiationException, androidx.fragment.app.Fragment.SavedState

      private android.widget.Button customNotificationButton

    • isJoiningEvent

      private boolean isJoiningEvent
      Joins the user to the event. It adds the user to the event's waiting list and to the user's list of joined events. If successful, it updates the join button to display "Unjoin" and shows a success message.

  • Constructor Details

    • EventDetailsFragment

      public EventDetailsFragment()

  • Method Details

    • onCreateView

      @Nullable public android.view.View onCreateView(@NonNull android.view.LayoutInflater inflater, @Nullable android.view.ViewGroup container, @Nullable android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Inflates the layout for the event details, initializes views, and loads event details from the database. It also sets visibility for buttons based on the activity (Entrant or Organizer).
      Overrides:
      onCreateView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      Parameters:
      inflater - The LayoutInflater object to inflate the layout.
      container - The parent view that the fragment's UI should be attached to.
      savedInstanceState - The saved instance state, if any, from the previous instance of the fragment.
      Returns:
      The root view of the fragment's layout.

    • initializeViews

      private void initializeViews(android.view.View view)
      Initializes all the UI elements (TextViews, Buttons) from the fragment layout.
      Parameters:
      view - The root view of the fragment's layout.

    • loadEventDetails

      private void loadEventDetails()
      Loads the details of the event from the Firestore database and populates the corresponding UI elements. If geolocation is enabled for the event, the UI is updated to show a warning about geolocation requirements.

    • checkUserInList

      private void checkUserInList()
      Checks if the user is already in the event's waiting list or selected list and updates the button state accordingly.

    • checkEventDates

      private void checkEventDates()
      This function checks if events registration dates or event dates have passed

    • checkWaitListCapacity

      private void checkWaitListCapacity()
      This function checks if the event waiting list capacity is full or if the event is still joinable. The function then updates the join event button accordingly.

    • setupButtonListeners

      private void setupButtonListeners()
      Sets up button listeners based on the activity type (Entrant or Organizer). If the user is in the Entrant activity, it enables the join/unjoin button and checks if the user is already in the list. If the user is in the Organizer activity, it enables buttons to view participants, edit the event, or view the QR code.

    • handleJoinButtonClick

      private void handleJoinButtonClick()
      Handles the join button click. If the user clicks "Join", it checks if geolocation is required. If geolocation is required, it prompts the user to confirm. If not, it proceeds to join the event. If the button displays "Unjoin", it unjoins the user from the event.

    • setButtonState

      private void setButtonState(String text, int color, boolean enabled)
      Sets the state of the join button (text and background color).
      Parameters:
      text - The text to be displayed on the button.
      color - The background color of the button.

    • handleViewParticipantsButtonClick

      private void handleViewParticipantsButtonClick()
      Handles the "View Participants" button click. Opens a new fragment to display the list of participants.

    • handleEditEventButtonClick

      private void handleEditEventButtonClick()
      Handles the "Edit Event" button click. (This feature is currently to be implemented.)

    • viewQRCodeButtonClick

      private void viewQRCodeButtonClick()
      Handles the "View QR Code" button click. Opens a fragment to display the event's QR code.

    • showGeolocationWarningDialog

      private void showGeolocationWarningDialog()
      Shows a dialog to warn the user that geolocation is required for this event. If the user confirms, the event will be joined.

    • joinEvent

      private void joinEvent()

    • unjoinEvent

      private void unjoinEvent()
      Unjoins the user from the event. It removes the user from both the event's waiting list and their list of joined events. If successful, it updates the join button to display "Join" and shows a success message.

    • getUserLocation

      private void getUserLocation()
      This function obtains the users location(coordinates) after requesting permission from them.

    • saveUserLocation

      private void saveUserLocation(double latitude, double longitude)
      This functions stores the users location in the database
      Parameters:
      latitude - the latitude of the users coordinates
      longitude - the longitude of the users coordinates

    • requestLocationPermission

      private void requestLocationPermission()
      This function checks if location permissions have been given, and asked for them if not.

    • handleCustomNotificationButtonClick

      private void handleCustomNotificationButtonClick()
      Handles the "Custom Notification" button click. Navigates to the CustomNotificationFragment, passing the event ID as an argument.

    • onRequestPermissionsResult

      public void onRequestPermissionsResult(int requestCode, @NonNull String[] permissions, @NonNull int[] grantResults)
      This function deals with a given permission request
      Overrides:
      onRequestPermissionsResult in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      Parameters:
      requestCode - The request code. A tag.
      permissions - The requested permissions
      grantResults - value indicating if permission has been granted or not

    • loadUserPins

      private void loadUserPins(String eventId)
      This function Obtains a given events coordinates and displays them on a map for the organizer
      Parameters:
      eventId - The unique id for the event, created from the QR code.

    • convertGeoToPixel

      private float[] convertGeoToPixel(float latitude, float longitude)
      This function converts user coordinates to a pixel value
      Parameters:
      latitude - the latitude of the user location
      longitude - the longitude of the user location
      Returns:
      a coordinate converted to a pixel location

    • displayPinsOnMap

      private void displayPinsOnMap(List<float[]> coordinates)
      This function updates the map to display the pins which are user coordinates
      Parameters:
      coordinates - a list of user coordinates

    • setVisibilityBasedOnActivity

      private void setVisibilityBasedOnActivity()
      Sets the visibility of the UI elements based on the type of activity the user is in (Entrant or Organizer). If the user is in the Entrant activity, it shows the join button and hides organizer-specific buttons. If the user is in the Organizer activity, it shows buttons for viewing participants, editing the event, and viewing the QR code.
